name: Apple
shortDescription: Crisp and sweet fruit packed with fiber and antioxidants
description: Apples are one of the most popular fruits worldwide, known for their crisp texture and sweet-tart flavor. They're an excellent source of dietary fiber, vitamin C, and various antioxidants that support overall health.

benefits.description: Rich in soluble fiber that helps lower cholesterol
High fiber content promotes healthy digestion
Vitamin C and antioxidants boost immune system

funFact: An apple tree can live for over 100 years and produce fruit for 50+ years!

name: Spinach
shortDescription: Nutrient-dense leafy green rich in iron and vitamins
description: Spinach is a superfood leafy green vegetable that's incredibly nutrient-dense. It's packed with iron, vitamins A, C, and K, folate, and antioxidants that support eye health, bone health, and overall wellness.

benefits.description: High in vitamin K and calcium for strong bones
Lutein and zeaxanthin protect eye health
Iron content helps prevent anemia and boosts energy

funFact: Popeye's love for spinach increased spinach consumption by 33% in the US!

name: Blueberry
shortDescription: Antioxidant powerhouse supporting brain and heart health
description: Blueberries are small but mighty fruits packed with antioxidants, particularly anthocyanins, which give them their deep blue color. They're excellent for brain health, memory, and cardiovascular wellness.

benefits.description: Anthocyanins improve memory and cognitive function
Antioxidants support cardiovascular health
Vitamin C promotes collagen production

funFact: Blueberries are one of the only naturally blue foods in nature!

name: Avocado
shortDescription: Creamy fruit rich in healthy fats and potassium
description: Avocados are unique fruits that are rich in monounsaturated fats, fiber, and potassium. They support heart health, nutrient absorption, and provide sustained energy.

benefits.description: Monounsaturated fats support heart health
Healthy fats and vitamin E nourish skin
Fiber and healthy fats promote satiety

funFact: Avocados are actually berries, and they ripen only after being picked!

name: Carrot
shortDescription: Orange root vegetable excellent for eye health
description: Carrots are crunchy, sweet root vegetables that are exceptionally high in beta-carotene, which the body converts to vitamin A. They're excellent for eye health, immune function, and skin health.

benefits.description: Beta-carotene supports healthy vision
Vitamin A promotes healthy skin cell production
Antioxidants boost immune system function

funFact: Carrots were originally purple! Orange carrots were developed in the Netherlands.

name: Basil
description: Basil is a fragrant herb belonging to the mint family. It's rich in essential oils, antioxidants, and has natural anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties. It's excellent for digestive health and stress relief.

benefits.description: Essential oils aid in digestion and reduce bloating
Antibacterial properties support immune health
Compounds may help reduce stress and improve focus

funFact: Basil is considered sacred in Hindu culture and is often grown near temples!

name: Banana
shortDescription: Energy-rich fruit high in potassium and vitamin B6
description: Bananas are one of the world's most popular fruits, known for their natural sweetness and energy-boosting properties. They're rich in potassium, vitamin B6, and natural sugars that provide quick energy.

benefits.description: Natural sugars provide quick, sustained energy
Potassium supports healthy blood pressure
Vitamin B6 supports neurotransmitter production

funFact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't! Botanically speaking, that is.

name: Broccoli
shortDescription: Cruciferous vegetable packed with vitamin C and fiber
description: Broccoli is a nutrient-dense cruciferous vegetable that's exceptionally high in vitamin C, fiber, and contains compounds that may have cancer-fighting properties. It's also rich in vitamin K and folate.

benefits.description: Extremely high vitamin C content boosts immunity
Vitamin K and calcium support bone health
High fiber content promotes digestive health

funFact: Broccoli is actually a flower! We eat the flower buds before they bloom.

name: Turmeric
shortDescription: Golden spice with powerful anti-inflammatory properties
description: Turmeric is a vibrant golden spice that contains curcumin, a compound with powerful anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It has been used in traditional medicine for thousands of years.

benefits.description: Curcumin has powerful anti-inflammatory effects
May support cognitive function and memory
Antioxidants support cardiovascular health

funFact: Turmeric has been used as a natural dye for over 4,000 years!

name: Strawberry
shortDescription: Sweet berry loaded with vitamin C and antioxidants
description: Strawberries are delicious, heart-shaped berries that are incredibly rich in vitamin C, manganese, and antioxidants. They're low in calories but high in flavor and nutrients that support immune and heart health.

benefits.description: Exceptionally high vitamin C content
Antioxidants protect against skin damage
Anthocyanins support cardiovascular health

funFact: Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside - about 200 seeds per berry!
